thread.title: Joliet Central football starts off and finishes strong despite loss
thread.title_full: Joliet Central football starts off and finishes strong despite loss

title: Joliet Central football starts off and finishes strong despite loss
text:
Joliet Central football starts off and finishes strong despite loss Published: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 11:52 p.m. CDT By LARRY LINDHOLM - Shaw Media Correspondent 
JOLIET â€“ Joliet Central started strong Friday night as the Steelmen scored on their first two possessions. That quick start couldn't help Central pick up its first win of the season, however, as Sandburg won, 55-19. Related Links Wilmington football barely streaks past Herscher for I-8 Small title 
On the Steelmen's first possession, Jomarre McNair caught a deflected pass from quarterback Zach Wisneski and raced down the left sideline for a 38-yard touchdown. 
Five plays after Jeremy Fennewald recovered a Sandburg fumble at the 36-yard line, McNair and Wisneski teamed up again for a 36-yard touchdown pass. With 5:54 left in the first quarter, Central led 13-0. 
The tide turned when Sandburg scored the next 55 points. 
The Eagles had a 14-13 lead at the end of the first quarter, 21-13 at halftime and 41-13 going into the fourth. Sandburg (5-1, 4-0) scored twice more in the final quarter to start the running clock. 
Joliet Central (0-6,0-4) found a way to the endzone on hard running from Ernest Grant, who dove from the 1-yard line. Grant led all rushers with 142 yards on 25 carries, 117 coming in the second half.
